data.name: Label1.Text
data.value:
Use the Forecast Form to find stocks with similar patterns. Those patterns may help forecast how a stock will behave.
In the Symbol text box, I typed in WDAY and clicked Graph to show the price chart for that stock (or use the Browse button to find the symbol). The chart appears above.
I right mouse clicked on price bars A and B (which automatically filled in pattern start and end dates) then clicked Preview to show the pattern, which appears in red. Small retraces are ignored. Note: The pattern’s end points (A or B) may be different from the ones selected. This pattern, the one you’re trying to find in other stocks, I call the benchmark pattern.
The chart shows a pattern with 4 segments, labeled 1-4. Strict rules work well with 3 segmented patterns, Normal with 4 or 5, and Loose with 6 or 7 segments. Adjust the rules (Strict, Normal, Loose, respectively) or the number of segments to allow more flexibility in finding similar patterns.
Click Start to begin. Found patterns will appear in the grid. Clicking a grid row shows the stock and associated pattern. It may look different from the benchmark pattern depending on the Rules you used, but it’ll have a similar ‘signature.’ A green line shows the move after the pattern ends (not all patterns will show this).
After a run ends and you wish to see the results again, click the Results button.
Reset restores the chart to show the benchmark stock.
All numbers are approximate (both on the grid and results message box). Clipboard button will show both Results button information and grid information.
See the website for more help. Past performance is no guarantee of future results. YOU AND YOU ALONE ARE RESPONSIBLE FOR YOUR INVESTMENT AND TRADING DECISIONS.
